intro: Leucanthemum serotinum, commonly known as late white daisy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped. Its flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn, featuring white ray florets surrounding yellow disk florets. It prefers well-drained soil and full to partial sunlight, making it a popular choice for garden borders and meadows.
